comments.body: Also need to check whether this is affected by the special implementation.  @couchand, maybe you can give a try of this PR at 57600 baud?
In worst case I think will be able to test this in next week.

For mega2560 same results. I will check now Uno rev3 for same baunds

baund| UBRR|tested|
-- | -- |--|
300 | 767 |ok |
600 | 383 |ok|
1200 | 191 |ok|
2400 | 95 |ok |
4800 | 47 |ok |
9600 | 23 |ok  |
14400 | 15 |failed |
19200 | 11 |ok |
28800 | 7 |failed |
38400 | 5 |ok |
57600 | 3 | ok|
76800 | 2 |failed |
115200 | 1|ok|
This is with the `BaudrateExt` trait, right?  So it seems 57600 and 115200 are working fine with the default implementation which means we don't need to switch for this board!
Yes. Looks like works fine. I'm able to test today uno rev3 too. Then I will need to reupload bootloader for mega2560...

If you don't have any objections, I'm content with the results you provided and would go ahead with merging your PR now.  Thank you so much for you work here!  You were a lot more thorough than most people would be which I appreciate a lot. :)

AFAIK the _Arduino Mega 2560_ also has pin-names printed onto the PCB so I'd suggest adding a `pins.rs` file for this board as well.  You can take [the one from Arduino Leonardo](https://github.com/Rahix/avr-hal/blob/master/boards/arduino-leonardo/src/pins.rs) as inspiration.

Of course.  It looks like multiplexed pins just have one alias with doc comments specifying other usages, and as far as I can tell every relevant pin on the Mega 2560 has a plain `dn`/`an` identifier, so there won't be dedicated `miso`, `mosi`, `sck`, `led_tx` and `led_rx` entries.  Does that sound right?

For a start, just add the labelled pins.

If you want to go further you'll have to take a look at the schematic whether any pins are connected elsewhere.  E.g. the `ICSP` connector, on-board peripherals, ... Though if pins have multiple connections, always prefer the label name, of course.
